segment.source: Server Management Console Application Virtualization System Node
segment.target: Server Management Console Application Virtualization System Node

segment.source: Server Management Console Application Virtualization System Node
segment.target: Server Management Console Application Virtualization System Node

segment.source: Server Management Console: Application Virtualization System Node
segment.target: Server Management Console: Application Virtualization System Node

segment.source: The Application Virtualization System node is the top-level node in the Scope pane.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization System node is the top-level node in the Scope pane.

segment.source: This node displays the name of the server the console is currently controlling, or it displays the name of the local computer (if you are connected by the name) or "local" when the console is connected to the local computer.
segment.target: This node displays the name of the server the console is currently controlling, or it displays the name of the local computer (if you are connected by the name) or "local" when the console is connected to the local computer.

segment.source: From the Application Virtualization System node, you can connect to another computer or you can connect to the current computer with a different set of credentials.
segment.target: From the Application Virtualization System node, you can connect to another computer or you can connect to the current computer with a different set of credentials.

segment.source: You can right-click the Application Virtualization System node to display the following elements.
segment.target: You can right-click the Application Virtualization System node to display the following elements.

segment.source: Configure Connection
segment.target: Configure Connection

segment.source: In this dialog box, you can modify the following settings:
segment.target: In this dialog box, you can modify the following settings:

segment.source: Web Service Host Name—Enables you to enter the name of the Application Virtualization System to which you want to connect, or you can enter localhost to connect to the local computer.
segment.target: Web Service Host Name—Enables you to enter the name of the Application Virtualization System to which you want to connect, or you can enter localhost to connect to the local computer.

segment.source: Use Secure Connection—Select if you want to connect to the server with a secure connection.
segment.target: Use Secure Connection—Select if you want to connect to the server with a secure connection.

segment.source: Port—Enables you to enter the port number you want to use for the connection.
segment.target: Port—Enables you to enter the port number you want to use for the connection.

segment.source: 80 is the default regular port number, and 443 is default secure port number.
segment.target: 80 is the default regular port number, and 443 is default secure port number.

segment.source: Use Current Windows Account—Select to use the current Windows account credentials.
segment.target: Use Current Windows Account—Select to use the current Windows account credentials.

segment.source: Specify Windows Account—Select when you want to connect to the server as a different user.
segment.target: Specify Windows Account—Select when you want to connect to the server as a different user.

segment.source: Name—Enables you to enter the name of the new user by using either the DOMAINusername or the username@domain format.
segment.target: Name—Enables you to enter the name of the new user by using either the DOMAINusername or the username@domain format.

segment.source: Password—Enables you to enter the password that corresponds to the new user.
segment.target: Password—Enables you to enter the password that corresponds to the new user.

segment.source: System Options
segment.target: System Options

segment.source: On the following tabs on this dialog box, you can modify the associated settings:
segment.target: On the following tabs on this dialog box, you can modify the associated settings:

segment.source: General Tab—Enables you to specify the Default Content Path where the OSD and icon files are stored.
segment.target: General Tab—Enables you to specify the Default Content Path where the OSD and icon files are stored.

segment.source: Database Tab—Enables you to specify the maximum Database Size and the Usage History.
segment.target: Database Tab—Enables you to specify the maximum Database Size and the Usage History.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: Changes the appearance of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: Changes the appearance of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: For more information about changing the appearance of the console, refer to the help files for the Microsoft Management Console.
segment.target: For more information about changing the appearance of the console, refer to the help files for the Microsoft Management Console.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Opens a new management console window.
segment.target: Opens a new management console window.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: Creates a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Starts the management console help file.
segment.target: Starts the management console help file.

segment.target: Related topics
